alert.note: Alert for Northwest Deserts, Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 08 at 1:58AM MST until August 08 at 8:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .Warm, dry, and breezy weather today. Elevated fire weather conditions expected this afternoon, with areas of critical conditions north of I-40. Main area of concern will be the AZ Strip, where sustained winds over 20 mph and wind gusts up to 35 mph are likely. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR PARTS OF MOHAVE COUNTY... * AFFECTED AREA...In Arizona...Fire weather zone 102, especially areas north of Interstate 40. * TIMING...Late this morning through this evening. * WIND...Southwest wind 20 to 25 mph with gusts approaching 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...Minimum humidity 5 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
